events.event_name: Bank of England interest rate decision
events.description: The Bank of England left interest rates unchanged at 3.75% but struck a more dovish tone than markets had anticipated.

facts.fact_text: The British pound fell below $1.36, its weakest level since January 22.

evidences.evidence_text: The British pound fell below $1.36, its weakest level since January 22

facts.fact_text: The Bank of England left interest rates unchanged at 3.75%.

evidences.evidence_text: the Bank of England left interest rates unchanged at 3.75%

facts.fact_text: The vote split among policymakers was 5-4 in favor of keeping rates steady.

evidences.evidence_text: the vote split surprised investors, with policymakers narrowly voting 5–4 in favor of keeping rates steady.

facts.fact_text: Four MPC members backed an immediate 25 basis point cut to 3.5%.

evidences.evidence_text: Four MPC members backed an immediate 25 basis point cut to 3.5%

facts.fact_text: CPI inflation is expected to fall back towards the 2% target from April.

evidences.evidence_text: CPI inflation is expected to fall back towards the 2% target from April.

claims.claim_text: The Bank of England struck a more dovish tone than markets had anticipated.

evidences.evidence_text: the Bank of England left interest rates unchanged at 3.75% but struck a more dovish tone than markets had anticipated.

claims.claim_text: Risks from persistent inflation have continued to diminish.
claims.author: Bank of England

evidences.evidence_text: The Bank said risks from persistent inflation have continued to diminish

claims.claim_text: Downside risks linked to weaker demand and a loosening labor market have become more prominent.
claims.author: Bank of England

evidences.evidence_text: while downside risks linked to weaker demand and a loosening labor market have become more prominent.

evidence.evidence_text: the Bank of England left interest rates unchanged at 3.75%
The Bank said risks from persistent inflation have continued to diminish
downside risks linked to weaker demand and a loosening labor market have become more prominent.
downside risks linked to weaker demand and a loosening labor market have become more prominent.
Sterling was also pressured by rising political uncertainty
